normalised: Hey folks, did you know Mumbai's garbage mountains are a bigger drama than a Karan Johar movie? Environmentalists are seriously worried about the piling waste. B M C, our Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, is facing a huge challenge. Recent reports suggest that the Deonar dumping ground alone adds tons of waste every day. Experts from I I T-Bombay are working on innovative solutions, like converting waste to energy. Remember Swachh Bharat Abhiyan? The movement definitely raised awareness. However, more needs to be done. Like, really. Imagine mountains of garbage taller than the Qutub Minar! We need better segregation at source, more composting initiatives in societies like in Delhi's Saket, and stricter enforcement of waste management rules. Think about it, every little bit helps! From not littering to composting your kitchen waste, let’s all do our bit for a cleaner India, shall we? Less "Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham," more "Swachh Bharat Abhiyan," folks!
